vectorData.altText: 9. What artery runs in the splenorenal ligament?
That's right! The splenic artery arises from the celiac trunk and runs to the left, retroperitoneally. it then runs through the splenorenal ligament to access the hilus of the spleen.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
such that your thumb is between the stomach and spleen and your fingers are around to the back, between the spleen and kidney     .
Hold the spleen in the palm of your right hand,
It runs between the spleen and kidney, hence the name!
It runs between the stomach and spleen, hence the name!
You KNOW where I’m going with this!
This works best if you are standing on the left side of the cadaver, and reaching over it with your right arm and hand.

The tip of your fingers are touching the splenorenal ligament     and the tip of your thumb is touching the gastrosplenic ligament     .
The spleen is a foregut structure     . It receives blood from the splenic artery, a branch of the      celiac trunk.
Find the aorta in the picture. The celiac trunk arises from the aorta and gives rise to the splenic artery. The splenic artery runs to the left, retroperitoneally, anterior to the left kidney. It then passes through the splenorenal ligament to enter the hilus of the spleen. At the hilus of the spleen, the splenic artery gives off branches that supply the stomach, the short gastric arteries and the left gastro-omental artery. These arteries access the stomach via the gastrosplenic ligament. 
Trace the route of these vessels on the diagram.
Notice that the spleen and its ligaments form the left lateral border of the lesser sac.
